abstract: One of the overlooked changes in the final financial regulatory bill was the removal of a proposed measure that would have made the Securities and Exchange Commission a self-financed agency.
snippet: One of the overlooked changes in the final financial regulatory bill was the removal of a proposed measure that would have made the Securities and Exchange Commission a self-financed agency.
lead_paragraph: One of the overlooked changes in the final financial regulatory bill was the removal of a proposed measure that would have made the Securities and Exchange Commission a self-financed agency, living off the fees it collects. The change means that the S.E.C will instead remain dependent on Congress for money, a big blow to those advocating more independence for the agency.

headline.main: For S.E.C., Self-Financing Remains but a Dream
